gurmukhi: qO hs bwq khI muskwie phlY niRp qwih pRnwm ju kIjY ]qO Bgvwn kQw Aiq rocn dY icq pY hm sy sun lIjY ]328]
transliteration: Tau Has Baat Kahimouskaae Pahlai Nrip Taah(i) Pranaam Ju Keejai|| Tau Bhagvaan Kathaa At(i) Rochannddai Chit Pai Ham Se Soun Leejai||328||
translation: Those women said smilingly, “Bow before that sovereign Krishna in the beginning and then listen to his interesting story.”328.

gurmukhi: swln Aau AKnI ibrIAw juj qwhrI Aaur pulwv Gny ]nugdI Aru syvkIAw icrvy lfUAw Aru sUq Bly ju bny ]
transliteration: Saalan Au Akhanndbireeaa Juj Taahriaur Pulaav Ghane|| Nougdiar(u) Sevakeeaa Chirve Ladooaa Ar(u) Soot Bhale Ju Bane||
translation: The meat roasted and cooked in various ways, dish of rice-soup-meat and spice etc., sweetmeat in the form of drops with a coating of sugar, noodles, preparation of soaked rice perched and beaten in a mortar, laddoo (sweet meat);

gurmukhi: Pun KIr dhI Aru dUD ky swQ bry bhu Aaur n jwq gny ]ieh Kwie clXo Bgvwn giHM khu sXwm kbIsur Bwv Bny ]329]
transliteration: Phoun Kheer Dahiar(u) Doodh Ke Saath Bade Bahu Aur Na Jaat Gade|| Eh Khaae Chadyo Bhagvaan Gihan Kauh Syaam Kabeesur Bhaav Bhane||329||
translation: Preparation of rice, milk and sugar boiled together, curd, milk etc., after eating all these, Krishna went towards his home.329.

gurmukhi: gwvq gIq cly giH ko gruVw DÍj jIX mY AwnMd pY kY ]soBq sXwm ky sMig hlI Gn sXwm Aau syq clXo aunsY kY ]
transliteration: Gadvat Geet Chale Gih Ko Gadudaa Dhvaj Jeeva Mai Aanand Pai Kai|| Sabhat Syaam Ke San(i) Halighan Syaam Au Set Chadyo Ounsai Kai||
translation: Singing songs and greatly pleased, Krishna went towards his home, Haldhar (Balram) was with him and this couple of white and black looked impressive;

gurmukhi: kwnH qbY his kY murlI su bjwie auTXo Apny kr lY kY ]TwF BeI jmnw suin kY Duin paun rhXo suin kY aurJY kY ]330]
transliteration: Kaahn Tabai Has(i) Kai Murlisu Bajaae Outhyo Apne Kar Lai Kai|| Thaadh Bhaijamnaa Soun(i) Kai Dhoun(i) Paoun Rahyo Soun(i) Kai Urjhai Kai||330||
translation: Then Krishna smilingly took his flute in his hand and began to play upon it; hearing its sound, even the water of Yamuna stopped and the blowing wind also in a fix.330.

gurmukhi: rwmklI Aru soriT swrMg mwlisrI Aru bwjq gaurI ]jYqisrI Aru gOf mlwr iblwvl rwg bsY suB TaurI ]
transliteration: Raamkaliar(u) Sorath(i) Saaran Maalsiriar(u) Baajat Gadddee|| Jaitsiriar(u) Gaddd Malaar Bilaaval Raag Basai Soubh Thauree||
translation: The musical modes like Ramkali, Sorath, Sarang, Malshri, Gauri, Jaitshri, Gaund, Malhar, Bilawal etc were played on the flute;

gurmukhi: mwns kI kh hY gnqI sun hoq surI AsurI Dun baurI ]so suin kY Duin sRaunn mY qrnI hrnI ijm Awvq daurI ]331]
transliteration: Maanas Kikah Hai Gadtisoun Hot Suriasuridhoun Bauree|| So Soun(i) Kai Dhoun(i) Sraounan Mai Tarnidarnijim Aavat Dauree||331||
translation: Leave side men, even the heavenly damsels and female demons, became mad on hearing the sound of the flute are coming with speed like the does.331

gurmukhi: bwjq bsMq Aru BYrv ihMfol rwg bwjq hY llqw ky swQ hÍY DnwsrI ]mwlvw klXwn Aru mwlkaus mwrU rwg bn mY bjwvY kwn mMgl inBwsrI ]
transliteration: Baajat Basant Ar(u) Bhairav Hindol Raag Baajat Hai Lalataa Ke Saath Hvai Dhanaadaree|| Maalvaa Kalyaan Ar(u) Maalkaous Maroo Raag Han Mai Bajaavai Kaan Mandal Nibhaasari||
translation: Krishna is playing on his flute in the forest, creating a joyous atmosphere, with the musical modes like Vasant, Bhairava, Hindol, Lalit, dhansari, Malwa, Kalyan Malkaus, Maru etc.

gurmukhi: surI Aru AwsurI Aau pMngI jy huqI qhwN Dunky sunq pY n rhI suD jwsrI ]khY ieau dwsrI su AYsI bwjI bwsurI su myry jwny XwmY sB rwg ko invws rI ]332]
transliteration: Suriar(u) Aasuriau Pannagite Houtitahaan Dhounke Sounat Pai Na Rahisudh Jaadaree|| Kahai Io Daasarisu Aisibaajibaasurisu Dere Jaane Yaamai Sabh Raag Ko Nivaas Ree||332||
translation: Hearing the tune, the young damsels of gods, demons and Nagas are forgetting the consciousness of their bodies; they are all saying that the flute is being played in the manner as if the male and female musical modes are living on all the four sides.332.
